name: Mac OS X Crash Log File

description: CRASH files can be submitted to Apple by selecting the Report... option after a crash. They also may be viewed using the built-in Mac OS X Console application. In the Mac OS X 10.6 Console application, CRASH files can be found by navigating to the following location: Log List → DIAGNOSTIC INFORMATION → User Diagnostic Reports .
CRASH files use the naming convention " [program]_[date]_[number]_[machine name].crash ." For example, an Apple Safari crash may be named Safari_2009-01-01_11223_my-iMac.crash .
Crash files are saved in a plain text format and are stored in the following directory: /​Library/​Logs/​DiagnosticReports
They also have a shortcut file in this directory: /​Library/​Logs/​CrashReporter
